article_text:
Small companies are starting to turn away from offering health plans as they seek to reduce costs and increasingly view the health law’s marketplaces as an inviting and affordable option for workers.

In the latest sign of a possible shift, WellPoint Inc. said Wednesday its small-business-plan membership is shrinking faster than expected and it has lost about 300,000 people since the start of the year, leaving a total of 1.56 million...

twitter.description: Small companies are starting to turn away from offering health plans, with many viewing the health law’s marketplace as an inviting and affordable option.
twitter.title: Small Firms Start to Drop Health Plans

image.alt: Some small firms stop offering health plans, often turning to health law’s marketplace
